intro: Rhododendron stolleanum, commonly known as the Himalayan rhododendron, is a deciduous shrub native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist climates. It is often found in forest understories at high elevations. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is a popular subject in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
